Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It is concluded that curcumin is able to attenuate in vivo maleate - induced nephropathy and in vitro cell damage .

Let's think step by step.

1. Maleate-induced nephropathy: This is a disease condition affecting the kidneys (nephropathy) that is induced or caused by maleate. Maleate is a compound that can cause damage to the kidneys when introduced into the body.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Disease.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It is concluded that curcumin is able to attenuate in vivo maleate - induced nephropathy and in vitro cell damage .

Let's think step by step.

1. Curcumin: It is a chemical compound. Curcumin is a polyphenol turmeric rhizome extract, which is the principal curcuminoid of turmeric. It is responsible for the yellow color of turmeric and has anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.

2. Maleate: Maleic acid is the parent compound of maleate. Maleate is an organic compound with the formula CH2(COOH)(COO-Alkyl/Aryl), where Alkyl/Aryl represents an alkyl or aryl group. Maleic acid is a monocarboxylic acid with a conjugated diene system. In the context of the paragraph, it seems that maleate is used as a compound that induces nephropathy (kidney damage).

3. Nephropathy: Nephropathy is a medical condition that refers to damage or disease of the kidneys. It is not a chemical entity, but it is mentioned in the context of the chemical entity curcumin's ability to attenuate (reduce the severity of) the condition.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Chemical.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
